subject: Photography
title: Forced Perspective Tricks
description: A short lesson to help you apply Forced Perspective Tricks.

hook.text: A tourist 'holds' the Leaning Tower of Pisa between their fingers. Forced perspective plays with reality.

buildup.text: Forced perspective exploits depth to make objects appear larger, smaller, closer, or farther than they really are.

discovery.text: It works because cameras flatten three dimensions into two. Size relationships depend entirely on distance to the lens.

twist.text: Hollywood uses forced perspective constantly. Hobbits looked tiny in Lord of the Rings without any CGI.

climax.text: Forced perspective reminds us that photography is illusion. The camera records a flat version of a 3D world.

punchline.text: In a photograph, size is just distance in disguise.

quiz.question: Why does forced perspective work in photography?
options: Cameras flatten 3D space into 2D, removing depth cues
It only works with certain subjects
